00035 struct rctf;

00038 void BLF_exit(void);

00043 int BLF_load_mem(const char *name, unsigned char *mem, int mem_size);

00050 /* Attach a file with metrics information from memory. */
00051 void BLF_metrics_attach(int fontid, unsigned char *mem, int mem_size);
00052 
00053 void BLF_aspect(int fontid, float x, float y, float z);
00054 void BLF_position(int fontid, float x, float y, float z);
00055 void BLF_size(int fontid, int size, int dpi);
00056 
00057 /* Set a 4x4 matrix to be multiplied before draw the text.
00058  * Remember that you need call BLF_enable(BLF_MATRIX)
00059  * to enable this.
00060  *
00061  * The order of the matrix is like GL:
00062  *
00063  *  | m[0]  m[4]  m[8]  m[12] |
00064  *  | m[1]  m[5]  m[9]  m[13] |
00065  *  | m[2]  m[6]  m[10] m[14] |
00066  *  | m[3]  m[7]  m[11] m[15] |
00067  *
00068  */
00069 void BLF_matrix(int fontid, const double m[16]);
00070 
00071 /* Draw the string using the default font, size and dpi. */
00072 void BLF_draw_default(float x, float y, float z, const char *str, size_t len);
00073 void BLF_draw_default_ascii(float x, float y, float z, const char *str, size_t len);
00074 
00075 /* Draw the string using the current font. */
00076 void BLF_draw(int fontid, const char *str, size_t len);
00077 void BLF_draw_ascii(int fontid, const char *str, size_t len);
00078 
00079 /* This function return the bounding box of the string
00080  * and are not multiplied by the aspect.
00081  */
00082 void BLF_boundbox(int fontid, const char *str, struct rctf *box);
00083 
00084 /* The next both function return the width and height
00085  * of the string, using the current font and both value 
00086  * are multiplied by the aspect of the font.
00087  */
00088 float BLF_width(int fontid, const char *str);
00089 float BLF_height(int fontid, const char *str);
00090 
00091 /* Return dimensions of the font without any sample text. */
00092 float BLF_height_max(int fontid);
00093 float BLF_width_max(int fontid);
00094 float BLF_descender(int fontid);
00095 float BLF_ascender(int fontid);
00096 
00097 /* The following function return the width and height of the string, but
00098  * just in one call, so avoid extra freetype2 stuff.
00099  */
00100 void BLF_width_and_height(int fontid, const char *str, float *width, float *height);
00101 
00102 /* For fixed width fonts only, returns the width of a
00103  * character.
00104  */
00105 float BLF_fixed_width(int fontid);
00106 
00107 /* and this two function return the width and height
00108  * of the string, using the default font and both value
00109  * are multiplied by the aspect of the font.
00110  */
00111 float BLF_width_default(const char *str);
00112 float BLF_height_default(const char *str);
00113 
00114 /* Set rotation for default font. */
00115 void BLF_rotation_default(float angle);
00116 
00117 /* Enable/disable options to the default font. */
00118 void BLF_enable_default(int option);
00119 void BLF_disable_default(int option);
00120 
00121 /* By default, rotation and clipping are disable and
00122  * have to be enable/disable using BLF_enable/disable.
00123  */
00124 void BLF_rotation(int fontid, float angle);
00125 void BLF_clipping(int fontid, float xmin, float ymin, float xmax, float ymax);
00126 void BLF_clipping_default(float xmin, float ymin, float xmax, float ymax);
00127 void BLF_blur(int fontid, int size);
00128 
00129 void BLF_enable(int fontid, int option);
00130 void BLF_disable(int fontid, int option);
00131 
00132 /* Shadow options, level is the blur level, can be 3, 5 or 0 and
00133  * the other argument are the rgba color.
00134  * Take care that shadow need to be enable using BLF_enable!!!
00135  */
00136 void BLF_shadow(int fontid, int level, float r, float g, float b, float a);
00137 
00138 /* Set the offset for shadow text, this is the current cursor
00139  * position plus this offset, don't need call BLF_position before
00140  * this function, the current position is calculate only on
00141  * BLF_draw, so it's safe call this whenever you like.
00142  */
00143 void BLF_shadow_offset(int fontid, int x, int y);
00144 
00145 /* Set the buffer, size and number of channels to draw, one thing to take care is call
00146  * this function with NULL pointer when we finish, for example:
00147  *
00148  *     BLF_buffer(my_fbuf, my_cbuf, 100, 100, 4);
00149  *
00150  *     ... set color, position and draw ...
00151  *
00152  *     BLF_buffer(NULL, NULL, 0, 0, 0);
00153  */
00154 void BLF_buffer(int fontid, float *fbuf, unsigned char *cbuf, int w, int h, int nch);
00155 
00156 /* Set the color to be used for text. */
00157 void BLF_buffer_col(int fontid, float r, float g, float b, float a);
00158 
00159 /* Draw the string into the buffer, this function draw in both buffer, float and unsigned char _BUT_
00160  * it's not necessary set both buffer, NULL is valid here.
00161  */
00162 void BLF_draw_buffer(int fontid, const char *str);
00163 
00164 /* Add a path to the font dir paths. */
00165 void BLF_dir_add(const char *path);
00166 
00167 /* Remove a path from the font dir paths. */
00168 void BLF_dir_rem(const char *path);
00169 
00170 /* Return an array with all the font dir (this can be used for filesel) */
00171 char **BLF_dir_get(int *ndir);
00172 
00173 /* Free the data return by BLF_dir_get. */
00174 void BLF_dir_free(char **dirs, int count);
00175 
00176 /* font->flags. */
00177 #define BLF_ROTATION (1<<0)
00178 #define BLF_CLIPPING (1<<1)
00179 #define BLF_SHADOW (1<<2)
00180 #define BLF_KERNING_DEFAULT (1<<3)
00181 #define BLF_MATRIX (1<<4)
00182 #define BLF_ASPECT (1<<5)
00183 
00184 #define BLF_DRAW_STR_DUMMY_MAX 1024

00188 extern int blf_mono_font_render; /* don't mess drawing with render threads. */
